result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • William J. Vosburgh was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • William J. Vosburgh was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#3

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY.  IID for a period of 36 months to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

miscConds.notes:
No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
Not enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

Provide DNA sample.
Comply with any correctional programming deemed necessary by DOC
DOC to look at and assess if Defendant needs mental health or cognitive therapy.
Allowed after 1st 48 hours if Defendant qualifies under Sheriff's rules.

timeConds.notes: release date is July 19, 2017 with good time.

03:35 Defendant William J. Vosburgh in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Defendant William J. Vosburgh in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court defendant can only be sentenced on count 1 or 2, not both. Court will sentence on count 1.  PSI is filed with court. Froelich does not have any amendments to PSI. Atty Piel request that on page 12 of PSI--it is not that defendant did not want personal contacts to be contacted but that defendant could not get the phone numbers for those contacts because he did not have his phone.  Court makes that change to PSI on page 12. Froelich: recommends probation and court to adopt DOC's recommendations in PSI. Atty Piel addresses the court.  Defendant addresses the court. Court reviews PSI on the record. Court provides defendant with firearm rights and voter ineligibility rights. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation on count 1, defendant cannot posess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs, only amount prescribed of prescription drugs, not to enter bars, taverns, or liquor stores, comply with correctional programming recommended by DOC,  AODA assessment, DNA Sample and Surcharge, pay supervision fees determined by DOC, fine $4026.00--$2400 base fine (includes DNA surcharge) due over probation, 3 year revocation of DL, 12 months in the PCJ on count 1 credit for good time, credit for 92 days, huber is allowed after first 48 hours if defendant qualifies with Sheriff's rules, release date is July 19, 2017, DOC to look at and assess if defendant needs mental health or cognitive therapy, S/W 2 years probation on count 3 same conditions as count 1 except for jail time, probation on count 1 and 3 to run concurrent. Appeal rights given to the defendant. 04:26
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

9:07  Defendant William J. Vosburgh in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:09  Judge Boles calls the case and Judge voir dire of the panel. Atty Froelich voir dires panel. Atty Piel voir dires the panel.  The attorneys make 4 strikes each. 12 jurors are selected and sworn in 10:08 recess.10:27 Court resumes. Attys, Defendant and jury are present. Judge gives preliminary jury instructions to the jury. 10:43 Atty Froelich gives opening statement 10:53   Atty Piel gives his opening statement. Officer Thomas Koehn is sw and ex by Froelich.  Exh # 1,2,3,4,5,6&7are photos of the vehicle. offered and received. exh 8 CD of body cam recording.  Offered and rec.  Witness IDs the defendant.  Atty Piel x-exams the officer. Atty Froelich re directs.   Ashley Greengard is sw and ex by Froelich  Exh  # 10 Blood Draw form.  Offered and rec. 12:00 Jury is excused for lunch.  Attorney Piel addresses the court regarding the screen with the body cam video and moves for a miss trial. Contains the # of the OWI on it. The court denies the motion for mistrial.The court will give a currative instruction. The attorneys are to make a screen shot of it for the record.  12:10  Court recesses.   1:13  Court resumes  Attys and defendant are in the courtroom. Judge reads the currative instruction that he will give to the attorneys for their approval. Exh # 11 & 12 are screenshots of the body cam video.  Exh 11 & 12 are offered and received.   Judge will read this when he jury returns.  1:19  Jury returns to the courtroom. Judges addresses them regarding the video and what they are to consider  Katherine Smith is sw and ex by Froelich.  Exh #13  Lab Report.   offered and received. Atty Piel x-exams.  State rests1:30  Jury is excused. Judge reviews the defendants right to testify in his own behalf.  1:37  Jury returns to the courtroom.  Shawn Nye is sw and ex by Atty Piel.  Froelich x-exams. Atty Piel re-directs.  Atty Piel recalls Officer Koehn and x-exams him. 1:54  Jury is excused attys and  Atty Piel and defendant leave the courtroom to confer re right to testify. 2:01  Jury returns to the courtroom William Vosburgh is sw and ex by Atty Piel. Atty Froelich exams the defendant. Defense rests. State recalls Officer Koehn. Piel x-exams. Froelich re-directs. Jury is excused for attorneys to do jury conference. Instructions and verdicts are given to the attorneys. Attorneys approve the verdicts.  Instructions are reviewed. 2:47  Recess until 2:55 3:04  Court resumes  Jury, attorneys and defendant are present. Jurors are given copies of the jury instructions.  The Judge instructs the jury. 3:20  Atty Froelich gives his closing arguement. 3:33  Atty Piel gives his closing arguement. 3:43 Froelich gives his final statement. 3:47  Judge reviews the verdict forms with the jury. The bailiffs are sworn and the jury is excused to deliberate. No objection to the instructions as read.  Exhibits will not to to the jury unless they request them.   Recess  3:53   4:41  Court resumes  The jury has a verdict and it is given to the Judge who reads it.
Ct 1 Guilty
Jury is excused. 
Court finds the defendant guilty of all 3 counts based on the jury verdict.   State requests a PSI.  Bond is revoked.

State requests the witnesses be sequestered. Court so orders. Froelich states the agreement on the OWI priors is 4. Instruction 235 is requested by the state.

4:12 p.m.  Defendant William J. Vosburgh in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich calls Prescott Police Dept Officer Thomas Koen.  Koen is sworn and takes the stand.  Froelich examines Koen.  Koen identifies defendant.  Piel has no questions.  Froelich does follow up.  Piel does follow up.  Froelich gives closing argument.  Piel gives closing argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

4:22 Defendant William J. Vosburgh in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court. Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.
